t: To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
In*pn the Lord*s I put my trust; How*ld can you say to my soul, “Flee*ld as*i a bird to your mountain”?
For*ld look! The wicked bend their*i bow, They*ld make ready their arrow on the string, That*ld they may shoot secretly at the upright in heart.
If*ld the foundations are destroyed, What*ld can the righteous do?
The*ln Lord*s is*i in His holy temple, The*ld Lord’s*s throne is*i in heaven; His*ld eyes behold, His*ld eyelids test the sons of men.
The*ld Lord*s tests the righteous, But*ld the wicked and the one who loves violence His soul hates.
Upon*ld the wicked He will rain coals; Fire*ld and brimstone and a burning wind Shall*ild be*i the portion of their cup.
For*ln the Lord*s is*i righteous, He*ld loves righteousness; His*ld countenance beholds the upright.
